CONCLUSION: Remainder inadmissible;Violation of Art. 6-1;Non-pecuniary damage - award
JUDGES: Anatoly Kovler;Christos Rozakis;Dean Spielmann;Elisabeth Steiner;Khanlar Hajiyev;Sverre Erik Jebens
TEXT: CARDINAL . The applicant was born in DATE and is serving a prison sentence in GPE , GPE .

CARDINAL . On an unspecified date NORP , PERSON . and PERSON . were arrested and charged , inter alia , with the murders of PERSON and PERSON When questioned , NORP and PERSON . testified that the applicant had hired them to kill B.
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant was arrested on suspicion of aiding and abetting the murder of B. He remained in custody pending trial and was repeatedly questioned by the investigator .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG set the trial for DATE .
CARDINAL . On DATE the head of the organised crime unit of the regional department of the interior informed ORG as follows :

“ Since DATE , [ the organised crime unit ] has been investigating [ S. 's murder ] ... Defendants [ D ] . , [ M ] . and [ PERSON . ] ... pleaded guilty and gave truthful statements . On the basis of those statements and the evidence collected it was possible to establish that a leader of the ORG organised criminal gang [ ORG ] had been involved in PERSON 's murder , committed in DATE . ORG has been put on the federal wanted list .

... [ The organised crime unit ] received information that the organised crime leaders had decided to kill NORP after he testified against ORG Furthermore , the police believe that NORP knows about other crimes committed by organised crime leaders in GPE .

Having regard to the above ... , we consider it possible that an attempt might be made to assassinate NORP We hereby request that the trial be closed to the public and conducted at correctional colony no . CARDINAL ...

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG decided to dispense with the public hearing of the criminal case against the applicant and NORP , PERSON , PERSON . and PERSON . The defendants or their lawyers were not present . In particular , the court noted as follows :

“ ORG of the Udmurtiya Republic received a letter from the head of the [ organised crime unit ] concerning the possibility that NORP would be assassinated during the trial . NORP had earlier testified about PERSON being involved in the crimes under investigation .

Having regard to the fact that [ ( CARDINAL ) ] the defendants are charged with particularly serious offences , including involvement in organised crime and [ ( CARDINAL ) ] the court is under obligation to ensure the safety of NORP and all parties to the proceedings , the employees of ORG of GPE and other persons , [ the court ] decides to close the trial and to conduct [ it ] at remand prison no . CARDINAL . Another reason to justify the closure of the trial is the fact that NORP is accused of murdering [ S. ] because the latter had raped [ NORP 's sister ] . ”

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG opened the trial at remand prison No . CARDINAL . The applicant was represented by counsel of his own choice . The court granted his request to hear additional witnesses on his behalf . The applicant pleaded not guilty and testified in court .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG of GPE found the applicant guilty of murder and sentenced him to DATE imprisonment . The court based its findings on the confessions provided by the applicant 's co - defendants NORP and PERSON , statements from CARDINAL witnesses , the crime scene investigation and forensic reports .
CARDINAL . The applicant appealed against the conviction . He complained about the lack of a public hearing of the criminal case against him and assessment of evidence by the first - instance court .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG of GPE upheld the judgment of DATE on appeal . The hearing was public . After hearing the applicant and his counsel , the court endorsed the lower court 's findings as to the points of fact and law . It appears from the text of the decision that the applicant 's argument regarding the lack of public hearing at first instance remained unanswered by the court .
CARDINAL . The Code of Criminal Procedure in force at the material time provided as follows :
Article CARDINAL . Public hearing
“ All matters shall be heard in a public hearing unless it contravenes the interests of protection of state secrets .

The [ court ] may decide ... to close a trial concerning persons under DATE , sex crimes and other cases in order to prevent the disclosure of information about the private lives of the parties to the proceedings .
The proceedings in the event of a closed trial , shall comply with all rules of [ criminal procedure ] .
The verdict shall be pronounced in public . ”
